reference.title: Frequently Asked Questions
reference.shortdesc: This topic contains answers to the most frequently questions about A/B and multivariate testing, automated decisioning, and targeting.

p.b: When will my campaign start?

refsyn.p: By default, campaigns are set to begin "When approved" and to end "When deactivated." However, you can set the start and end dates manually, including time of day, when you create or edit a campaign. Campaigns that do not specify time of day begin at midnight and end at 23:59:59.

p.b: How are impressions, visits and new visitors counted?

refsyn.p: See About the Data.

p.b: Do visitors see the same content throughout the life of the campaign?

refsyn.p: By default in most campaigns and tests, returning visitors, even if converted, will see the same content through the life of the campaign. This behavior can be changed by using the advanced settings for success metrics. (See Success Metric Advanced Options.) The exception is the Landing Page test which can use experience level targeting to force a returning visitor to see new content.

p.b: I am concerned with visitor privacy. What data is sent to Adobe servers?

refsyn.p: Adobe does not collect personally identifiable information. Adobe collects at a minimum visitors, clicks and conversions for all tests. All data captured by Adobe Target is linked to a visitor ID, but there is no personal data related to that visitor ID. At an aggregate level, the success metrics defined in a campaign are tracked. This data is not available at an individual visitor level. Visitor profile data is stored per visitor, but is linked to the visitor only by the anonymous visitor ID or mboxPCId value.
For information on the current state of global privacy, how it's changing, and how it might affect you and your business, view the Adobe Target Privacy Webinar.

p.b: Can I display more than one offer in an mbox?

refsyn.p: No. An mbox may display only one offer. However you may create a larger mbox and use a larger offer to display several elements of the Web site. See Creating a Whole Page Mbox.

p.b: How do offers and mboxes impact search engines and automated browsing utilities?

refsyn.p: Most search engine robots do not execute JavaScript, so the content served in an offer does not affect search results or search engine rankings. Your Default Content, because it is still on the page, continues to influence the search engine results as it would without an mbox.

p.b: Will an mbox add another cookie to the current list already returned by our Web application?

refsyn.p: Yes, another First Party cookie is added, named "mbox." Third party cookies can be used as well in instances where you need to track the visitor across domains. Speak with your account representative to set this up.

p.b: Will the mbox code, which automatically attaches to a body onLoad() event, conflict with other embedded JavaScript in our pages?

refsyn.p: No. Code is added at the end of the onLoad() event, in order to ensure that it does not conflict with other JavaScript calls in your pages.

p.b: We have an internally-built proprietary content management system. Do we continue use this or have a separate interface to manage content with AdobeTarget?

refsyn.p: Target coexists perfectly with your content management tool. You define the content to be delivered and where it should reside. The tested content can be static or dynamic HTML and uses the same format as your content management tool. You can choose to create offers that point to content stored on your content management system. You can also store the content directly in Target, bypassing your content management system.

p.b: Can I track conversion off-line? For example, people register on my Web site, then turn into actual clients after they speak to our representatives by phone.

refsyn.p: Use the combined offline conversion/third-party profile API.

p.b: Is a first party cookie or a third party cookie dropped onto the visitor's browser?

refsyn.p: By default, Test&Target drops a first party cookie. You can also use a third party cookie if you need to track visitors across different domains. A first party cookie. See How Test&Target Works for more information.

p.b: Can more than one conversion event be tracked?

refsyn.p: Yes. See Managing Success Metrics for more information.

p.b: How many mboxes can I have on one page?

refsyn.p: It's recommended that you limit your mboxes to five to seven per page. However you can also use a whole-paged-size mbox and use large offers to display as many elements of the Web site as you need.

p.b: Does the mbox.js reference need to be on every page of my site?

refsyn.p: The mbox.js must be referenced on every page with an mbox. See Downloading and Setting Up Mbox.js or Creating a Single Mbox for more information.

p.b: What do the confidence bars in the reports indicate?

refsyn.p: Four bars indicates the highest level of confidence. You can hover over the percentage bars to see the confidence percentage. See Confidence Level and Confidence Interval for more information.

p.b: Can I insert an mbox within an mbox? For example, an mbox with a small piece of dynamic content inside a static page sized mbox?

refsyn.p: Yes. Place a reference to the mbox within the HTML offer itself. Warning! Do not place the smaller mbox within the default content of the larger mbox. The consequence will be a flashing page for the visitor.

p.b: Where should I host my images, code and other content?

refsyn.p: You can host offers on your server, on Adobe servers or a third party server. Use the method best suited to your architecture. In the offers, insert a relative or absolute URL to refer to the content, as best suited to your file structure.

p.b: Why are some of the features grayed out in the interface?

refsyn.p: Depending on your contract level, you may not have access to all the features. Speak with your Sales Representative or account representative if you have questions about this.

p.b: Which campaigns are using my mbox?

refsyn.p: To see the list of campaigns using your mbox, select Locations > List.

p.b: Can I control the conditions under which a user is counted again after they convert for the first time?

refsyn.p: Yes. See Success Metric Advanced Options for more information.

p.b: How can I control the experience a user sticks to after they convert?

refsyn.p: See Success Metric Advanced Options for more information.

p.b: Can I change the time zone that my reports refer to?

refsyn.p: Yes. To change your time zone after signup, ask your account representative to change it for you.

p.b: If I want to change the success metric for my automated campaign, can I simply change it, or do I need to create a brand new campaign for the modeling to start working with my new metric?

refsyn.p: As long as the conversion point stays the same (i.e. still the order confirmation page, not changing to the shopping cart page) then it is best to simply change the success metric for the modeling system. The modeling system quickly updates upon saving the campaign to build new models.
If the conversion point changes, then it is best to copy the campaign, make the required conversion changes, and start this new campaign fresh."

p.b: Why does the automated traffic estimator change when I change the success metric (conversion rate vs AOV vs RPV)?

refsyn.p: Revenue per visitor and average order value require real numbered values instead of binary success/failure event like conversion rate. This means that there is more noise in the revenue-based data, and it may be harder for the system to discern which of the options is best to display. Therefore, it takes more traffic for RPV and AOV-based campaigns to be successful.

p.b: What is the character limit of the mbox name?

refsyn.p: 255 characters.

p.b: How big is the mbox.js?

refsyn.p: About 12k. This size can be affected in several different ways, including compression level or adding custom JavaScript to your mbox.js. Compression can either be weak or strong, with about a 3K variance between them.

p.b: Can JavaScript exist in the default content?

refsyn.p: Yes.

p.b: Can JavaScript be inserted in the HTML offer?

refsyn.p: Yes.

p.b: Can JavaScript be used to create custom targets?

refsyn.p: Yes. These custom targets are known as profile scripts. Profile scripts can be created in the Administration area and are used in the targeting interface in the Visitor Behavior parameter. For more information, see Expressions Targets. Also see our JavaScript Expression Targeters cheat sheet (pdf).

p.b: What are the length requirements for the mbox3rdpartyid parameter?

refsyn.p: This parameter is limited to 60 characters in length. For more information about the mbox3rdpartyid parameter, refer to the Developer Connection.

p.b: Is there a way to see which campaigns I belong to on a site?

refsyn.p: Yes. There are two ways:

ul.li: The user.activeCampaigns profile returns an array of the campaigns you are in. See .

You can use the mboxHighlight feature of the Digital Pulse Debugger:
javascript:void(window.open("","dp_debugger","width=600,height=600,​location=0,menubar=0,​status=1,toolbar=0,​resizable=1,scrollbars=1")​.document.write("<script​ language=\"JavaScript\"​ id=dbg src=\" https://www.adobetag.com/d1/digitalpulsedebugger/live/DPD.js\"></"+"script>"));

p.b: Is there a way to exclude certain IP addresses?

refsyn.p: The exclude IPs feature is an account-level setting that can be changed by Client Care or your consultant. There is no access to this feature in the Target interface.
